summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The primary discussion concerns logistical planning for a trip to Stockholm, Sweden, in late January/early February 2020 to conduct an interview, including approvals for flights and hotel accommodations that exceed the government per diem. The emails reference multiple prior trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maureen Comey
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial travel approval request for the Epstein investigation, identified as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The SDNY prosecution team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel permission for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel permission for an interview in Los Angeles.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requested travel permission for an interview in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel permission for a victim interview in Los Angeles.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requested travel permission for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, to interview victims.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requested travel permission for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Initial travel request for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively conducting interviews for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618) internationally in Stockholm, Sweden, as of January 2020.
The investigation involved repeated travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles, CA, and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, FL, throughout 2019.

The document shows the prosecution team seeking approval for logistical details like flights (preferring domestic carriers) and hotel conference rooms for interviews, indicating formal, ongoing investigative work.
The case is formally titled 'United States v. Epstein' and concerns 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'

Multiple email addresses and names are redacted in the correspondence, indicated by placeholders like 'Cc: )' and 'To: M =>', suggesting the involvement of other officials whose identities are protected.
